item.title: Surprise! Capcom Is Bringing Pragmata To Switch 2, Demo Out Today
item.content:encoded:
Pre-orders are also live

At The Game Awards preshow, it's been announced Capcom will be bringing Pragmata to the Switch 2 on 24th April 2026.

Pre-orders are now live, and a demo is coming out later for Switch 2 and other console platforms, so you'll be able to try it out before the full release next year. This is a new IP from Capcom, focused on science fiction action-adventure gameplay with a "hacking twist".

"It is the near future, and protagonists Hugh and his android companion Diana, must work together as they make their way through the cold lunar research station."

You can find out a little more about this upcoming release from Capcom in a preview over on sibling site Push Square:

Would you be interested in playing this title on the Switch 2? Let us know in the comments.

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply

item.title: Xbox Is Bringing Another Game To Switch 2 In Spring 2026
item.content:encoded:
Compulsion Games' South of Midnight

Xbox is now bringing its games to other platforms, and following a bunch of announcements in recent years, another first-party title has been locked in.

South of Midnight by Compulsion Games will coming to the Switch 2 (and PS5) in Spring 2026. This title originally made its debut on the Xbox Series X|S earlier this year in April.

If you're not familar with this title it's a third-person action-adventure described as being set in a "magic realist version of American South". You can find out more about it in a review on Pure Xbox:

Would you be interested in this game? Let us know in the comments.

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

item.title: Watch: The Game Awards 2025 - Live!
item.content:encoded:
Trophy hunting

Our next dose of Geoff is right around the corner, as we are mere minutes away from The Game Awards 2025.

This year's event kicks off at 5pm PST / 8pm EST / 1am GMT (Fri) / 2am CET (Fri) / 10am JST (Fri), though, as ever, a pre-show 'Opening Act' will begin half an hour before that — and you can expect to see some awards given out there too.

Here's the precise time that you'll be able to tune into the Opening Act in your region:

  • North America: 4:30pm (Thu) PST / 5:30pm (Thu) MST / 6:30pm (Thu) CST / 7:30pm (Thu) EST
  • UK/Ire: 12:30am GMT
  • Europe: 1:30am CET / 2:30am EET
  • Asia/Oceania: 9:30am JST / 8:30am AWST / 11:30am AEDT

Normally, TGAs aren't packed with Switch news, but there are a lot of big hitters we enjoyed on Nintendo consoles this year up for some headline awards. We've got Donkey Kong Bananza, Hollow Knight Silksong, and Hades II all up for GOTY, and Mario Kart World is in the running for a few trophies too.

There's every chance that we'll hear some third-party Switch 2 news from this one, too, with the fresh hybrid still very much being the new kid on the block. Don't go expecting anything from Nintendo itself, but an announcement of a port or two might be on the cards.

Whatever the event throws our way, we'll be here to watch along with you. You can watch the full event — from the Opening Act right up to the final award — and have a natter while you do it, below.



https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2025/12/watch-the-game-awards-2025-live
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot
